\begin{document}

\title{Mathematical Modelling (APM1514)}

\author{S Myeni (34537023)}

\maketitle
Question 1

\medskip{}

$\frac{dy}{dt}$ = 2(4 - y)

$\Rightarrow$$\frac{dy}{4-y}$ = 2dt

$\Rightarrow\int\frac{dy}{4-y}$ = $\int2dt$

$\Rightarrow$-ln|4-y| = 2t + C

$\Rightarrow$ln $\left|4-y\right|$ = -2t + C

$\Rightarrow$4-y = e$^{-2t+C}$ = Ae$^{-2t}$

$\Rightarrow$-y = -4 + Ae$^{-2t}$

$\therefore$y = 4 + Ae$^{-2t}$

\rule[0.5ex]{1\columnwidth}{1pt}

Question 4

\medskip{}

$\frac{dy}{dt}$ = 1 - 4y, y(1) = 5

$\frac{dy}{1-4y}$ = dt, separation of variables

$\int\frac{dy}{1-4y}$ = $\frac{1}{1}\text{·}\int dt$

$\int\frac{dy}{y-\frac{1}{4}}$ = -4$\int dt$, divide LHS \& RHS
denominators by -4

ln|y-$\frac{1}{4}$| = -4$\frac{t^{2}}{2}$ + C

y-$\frac{1}{4}$ = e$^{-2t^{2}+C}$

$\Rightarrow$ y = $\frac{1}{4}$ + Ae\textasciicircum{}\{-2t\textasciicircum{}2\}
\end{document}
